title: NYCAM
summary: Portals of Remembrance exhibition reimagining the New York City AIDS Memorial
description: Portals of Remembrance was an exhibition produced by Kinfolk, reimagining the New York City AIDS Memorial through the work of celebrated contemporary artists. Presented at St. Vincent's Triangle, the project honored underrepresented figures within the HIV and AIDS movement, from Black horse jockeys to disco icon Sylvester. Guided by Kinfolk's vision, the exhibition bridged timelines and communities, transforming the memorial into a living archive of resilience, joy, and collective memory.
